title: The Dolder Grand, Zurich is named the Hotel of The Year 2016 by Carl F. Bucherer and Gault Millau Switzerland
text:
Switzerland The Dolder Grand, Zurich is named the Hotel of The Year 2016 by Carl F. Bucherer and Gault Millau Switzerland The Dolder Grand, Zurich is named the Hotel of The Year 2016 by Carl F. Bucherer and Gault Millau Switzerland Details Category: Switzerland Created on Thursday, 03 September 2015 10:45 Gault Millau Switzerland and sponsor, Carl F. Bucherer, have named the iconic Zurich hotel, The Dolder Grand, ‘Hotel of the Year 2016'. In an official ceremony held on August 31st, the luxury hotel was awarded the prestigious title by Sascha Moeri, CEO of Carl F. Bucherer, and Urs Heller, chief editor of Gault Millau Switzerland. 
This is the ninth year the renowned restaurant guide, Gault Millau, has partnered with Bucherer, a luxury watch purveyor, to select the winner of the coveted ‘Hotel of the Year’ title. The Dolder Grand was praised by judges for its exceptional culinary offerings, breathtaking views and bespoke art collection, and of course the spectacular 4,000-square metre Spa. Founded in 1969, Gault Millau is renowned for detailed reviews of gourmet cuisine across the international hospitality industry, whilst Bucherer is a leading retailer of luxury watch brands. The coveted ‘Hotel of the Year’ award stands for excellence, passion and superlative quality, values at the heart of both Gault Millau, and Bucherer. Luxurious city resort, The Dolder Grand, boasts 176 beautifully appointed rooms and suites with panoramic views over the vibrant city centre, Lake Zurich and the Alps. The Restaurant, awarded 18 Gault Millau points and 2 Michelin stars, serves up flavourful mastery and innovative gourmet food, under the watchful eye of Fine Dining Chef, Heiko Nieder.
